meanings.definition: A connection or relationship between two or more things.
meanings.sent1: The linkup between the two ideas was clear and easy to understand.
meanings.sent2: The linkup between the two gears ensured smooth operation.
meanings.sent3: The linkup between the cat and the mouse led to an unexpected friendship.
meanings.sent4: The linkup between music and emotions is powerful and moving.
meanings.sent5: The linkup between the colors created a beautiful painting.

meanings.sent1: I will linkup the cables to establish a strong connection.

meanings.sent3: The magician tried to linkup the broken rope with magic.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to linkup the whole room in happiness.
meanings.sent5: The bridge will linkup the two sides of the river.

meanings.definition: A meeting or gathering of people or things.
meanings.sent1: The linkup of old friends brought joy and laughter.
meanings.sent2: The linkup of different departments improved communication.
meanings.sent3: The linkup of cats in the park was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The linkup of stars in the sky created a mesmerizing view.
meanings.sent5: The linkup of ideas at the conference sparked innovation.
